results.title: Healing is believing
results.creator_credit: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Under southern skies”.
In this episode, host Sue Henckel travels to the Gulf of Carpentaria where her guide Thancoupie, an aboriginal healer, takes her on a practical excursion revealing her traditional knowledge of plants that have been used for centuries for their medicinal properties. Thancoupie collects a variety of plants and prepares them to treat ailments such as diarrhoea, colds and tropical ulcers. She also reveals methods used by her ancestors to control their birth-rate discussing the consequences of large families in nomadic tribes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media

results.title: Healing and the mind. Eps. 4-6
results.creator_credit: Pamela Mason Wagner and David Griebin Productions
results.brief_description: Broadcast journalist Bill Moyers reports on new insights into mind-body connections, and on some of the people - scientists, physicians and patients - who are describing new ways to think about “sickness” and “health”. “The art of healing” introduces health care professionals who recognise that emotional states play an important role in people’s vulnerability to disease, and in their recovery. Most people view illness as a mechanical breakdown that afflicts the body and requires technical care, “Wounded healers” investigates what it really means to get well.

results.title: Healing and the mind. Eps. 1-3
results.creator_credit: Pamela Mason Wagner and David Griebin Productions
results.brief_description: Broadcasting journalist Bill Moyers reports on new insights into mind-body connections, and on some of the people - scientists, physicians and patients - which are describing new ways to think about “sickness” and ” health”. “The mystery of Chi” is filmed on location in Beijing and Shanghai, Moyers explores the role of the energy force known as chi in Chinese medicine and its implications for healing. “Mind-body connection” investigates medical scientists on the frontier of mind-body research. “Healing from within” examines Eastern meditation and Western group psychotherapy - methods which can teach people to use their minds to improve the healing capacity of their bodies.

results.title: Healing
results.creator_credit: Pierre Lasry, Michael McKennirey, Arthur Hammond and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Balancing moments of strong emotional impact with cool-headed logic, this documentary explores the phenomenon of faith healing. Scenes of Kathryn Kuhlman’s dramatic performance before 25 000 people at the Ottawa Civic Centre are balanced by interviews with articulate doctors and scientists who argue both sides of the “healing” issue. (Award: Columbus.)

results.title: Healing
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Judith Odgers
results.brief_description: Judith is teaching in Thailand as a young teacher. It is an extraordinary cultural experience and also life changing as Judith is diagnosed with HIV. This story delves into the psyche of a young woman coming to terms with the taboos and limitations of the virus she has contracted.

results.title: Healers quacks or mystics
results.creator_credit: Richard Corfield, Brian Nicholls, Bernice Daly and ABC
results.brief_description: Alternative medicine offers us many options. Some approaches focus more on healthy body, others on healthy mind. But in all there is a common underlying theme, and that is that the individual can do a lot to keep themselves well. We don’t have to prop ourselves up with pills, or overload our bodies with junk food and stress. In this series, Nevill Drury takes us through a wide range of alternative therapies and treatments now available in Australia.

results.title: Headstart for Omar
results.creator_credit: Myrtle Winter-Chaumeny, United Nations Television and United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East
results.brief_description: Omar was a boy when he fled with his parents from the family orange grove near Jaffa and joined 750,000 Palastinian Arab refugees streaming out of the new State of Israel. Ever since then Omar has waited and now lives in Qatar, where he works and bides his time. Like others of 1948, Omar waits for the world community to settle a long overdue account.

results.title: Heads and tails
results.creator_credit: Michael Cole and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A film for children, looking at bird behaviour. Focuses mainly on newt swans but also shows peacocks, turkeys, farmyard chickens and ducks. Narrated by Derek Griffiths.
